title: How to Earn a Gardening Badge in Animal Crossing: New Leaf

steps.headline: Look at the Backyard Gardener Badge.
steps.description:
You'll need to plant trees and flowers around your town. Bronze rank: 100 trees and/or flowers planted
Silver rank: 250 trees and/or flowers planted
Gold rank: 500 trees/or flowers planted

steps.headline: Look at the Weed Badge.
steps.description:
You'll need to pull weeds in your town -- same tiring activity as in the other Animal Crossing games, but this time, you'll get a badge for it! Bronze rank: 500 weeds pulled
Silver rank: 2,000 weeds pulled
Gold rank: 5,000 weeds pulled

steps.headline: Locate Phineas.
steps.description: When a player achieves the minimum for a level, Phineas will appear somewhere in town on clear days.

steps.headline: Talk to him.
steps.description: At times, he'll give you multiple badges, so just keep pressing buttons.

steps.headline: View your badge on your Town Pass Card.
steps.description: Learn that ranks override each other, so if you achieve a bronze, a silver one will override it instead of showing both ranks.

text:
Look at the Backyard Gardener Badge. You'll need to plant trees and flowers around your town. Bronze rank: 100 trees and/or flowers planted
Silver rank: 250 trees and/or flowers planted
Gold rank: 500 trees/or flowers planted Look at the Weed Badge. You'll need to pull weeds in your town -- same tiring activity as in the other Animal Crossing games, but this time, you'll get a badge for it! Bronze rank: 500 weeds pulled
Silver rank: 2,000 weeds pulled
Gold rank: 5,000 weeds pulled Accomplish the minimum amount required.  Locate Phineas. When a player achieves the minimum for a level, Phineas will appear somewhere in town on clear days. Talk to him. At times, he'll give you multiple badges, so just keep pressing buttons. View your badge on your Town Pass Card. Learn that ranks override each other, so if you achieve a bronze, a silver one will override it instead of showing both ranks.
